logic.workstation

Class Workstation

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.workstation.Workstation
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccessoriesPost, CarBodyPost, DriveTrainPost

    public abstract class Workstation
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to describe a work station of an assembly line.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Workstation()
      Constructs a workstation and initializes the current order and next workstation to null.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void adjustDelays(int phaseDuration)
      Adjust the delays of orders in the chain of workstations.
      void advanceWorkstations(Order order)
      Moves the assembly line forward, if possible, by moving all orders in the chain to the next workstation in the chain, and adding the given order to the first workstation in the chain.
      boolean allIdle()
      Checks if all workstations in the chain are idle.
      void buildOrderList(java.util.List<Order> orders)
      Builds a list of orders, by adding copies all orders that are currently in the chain to the back of the given list.
      void buildWorkstationList(java.util.List<Workstation> workstations, int numberOfWorkstations)
      Builds a list of workstations, by adding copies of the workstations in the chain to the back of the given list of workstations.
      boolean canMoveAssemblyLine()
      Checks whether the assembly line can be moved, which is when all pending tasks at each workstation in the chain have been completed.
      int countWorkStations()
      Counts the number of workstations in the chain.

      Checks whether all tasks, of the current order which can be performed on this workstation, have been completed.

      Lets the chain of workstations perform a task corresponding to the given task.

      Checks if this object is the same as a given object.

      Lets the chain of workstations build a list of all tasks at a given workstation.

      Get the types of tasks that can be performed on this workstation.

      Returns a copy of the order currently being serviced by this workstation.
      Order getLastOrder()
      Returns the order in the last workstation, if all tasks on the order are completed, so that it can be given to the statistics.

      Returns the phase duration of the order in the workstation specified by the workstationNumber.

      Recalculates the estimated completion times of the orders currently in the chain.

      Sets the given order as the current order.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Workstation

        public Workstation()
        Constructs a workstation and initializes the current order and next workstation to null. If the current order is null the workstation represents an idle workstation. If the next workstation is null, this workstation represents the last workstation in the chain of workstations.

    • Method Detail

      • setWorkStation

        public void setWorkStation(Workstation next)
        Set the next workstation in the chain of workstations to the given workstation, if and only if this workstation's next workstation has not been set yet.
        Parameters:
        next - The next workstation in the chain of workstations.

      • canMoveAssemblyLine

        public boolean canMoveAssemblyLine()
        Checks whether the assembly line can be moved, which is when all pending tasks at each workstation in the chain have been completed.
        Returns:
        True if all pending tasks in the chain have been completed. False otherwise.

      • advanceWorkstations

        public void advanceWorkstations(Order order)
        Moves the assembly line forward, if possible, by moving all orders in the chain to the next workstation in the chain, and adding the given order to the first workstation in the chain.
        Parameters:
        order - The new order that has to be added to the first workstation of the chain.

      • getCurrentOrder

        public Order getCurrentOrder()
        Returns a copy of the order currently being serviced by this workstation. When the current order is null, the workstation is idle.
        Returns:
        A copy of the current order.

      • idle

        public boolean idle()
        Returns whether or not this workstation has been assigned an order to work on.
        Returns:
        True if the current order is null. False otherwise.

      • done

        public boolean done()
        Checks whether all tasks, of the current order which can be performed on this workstation, have been completed.
        Returns:
        True if and only if there isn't a task left that this workspace can complete for the current order. False otherwise.

      • setOrder

        public void setOrder(Order order)
        Sets the given order as the current order. The task list will be cleared and updated with the compatible task(s) of the new order.
        Parameters:
        order - Any order. Can be completed, semi-completed, or not started.

      • getCapabilities

        public abstract java.util.List<CarPartType> getCapabilities()
        Get the types of tasks that can be performed on this workstation. This method completely defines the capabilities of an implementing class.
        Returns:
        A List of CarPartType elements defining the capabilities of the implementation.

      • doTask

        public boolean doTask(Task task)
        Lets the chain of workstations perform a task corresponding to the given task.
        Parameters:
        task - A copy of the task that needs to be performed.
        Returns:
        True if the specified task has been successfully performed. False otherwise.

      • getRequiredTasks

        public java.util.List<Task> getRequiredTasks(Workstation station)
        Lets the chain of workstations build a list of pending tasks at a given workstation.
        Parameters:
        station - The a copy of the workstation for which the pending tasks are needed.
        Returns:
        A list of tasks that are pending at the given workstation.

      • getAllTasks

        public java.util.List<Task> getAllTasks(Workstation station)
        Lets the chain of workstations build a list of all tasks at a given workstation.
        Parameters:
        station - The a copy of the workstation for which the tasks are needed.
        Returns:
        A list of tasks at the given workstation.

      • buildWorkstationList

        public void buildWorkstationList(java.util.List<Workstation> workstations,
                        int numberOfWorkstations)
        Builds a list of workstations, by adding copies of the workstations in the chain to the back of the given list of workstations. The amount of workstations to add is also specified.
        Parameters:
        workstations - The list of workstations, to which the chain has to be added.
        numberOfWorkstations - The amount of workstations that has to be added to the chain.

      • buildOrderList

        public void buildOrderList(java.util.List<Order> orders)
        Builds a list of orders, by adding copies all orders that are currently in the chain to the back of the given list. Idle workstations don't add their (null) order.
        Parameters:
        orders - The list of orders, to which orders in the chain need to be added.

      • reschedule

        public org.joda.time.DateTime reschedule(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> prePhaseDurations,
                                int NbOfWorkstations,
                                org.joda.time.DateTime currentTime)
        Recalculates the estimated completion times of the orders currently in the chain.
        Parameters:
        prePhaseDurations - A list with the standard phase durations of the orders that come after the order in this workstation.
        NbOfWorkstations - The number of workstations in the chain.
        currentTime - The current time.
        Returns:
        The estimated completion time of the order in this workstation.

      • countWorkStations

        public int countWorkStations()
        Counts the number of workstations in the chain.
        Returns:
        The number of workstations in the chain.

      • getTotalEstimatedEndTime

        public org.joda.time.DateTime getTotalEstimatedEndTime()
        Returns the latest estimated end time of all orders in the chain of workstations.
        Returns:
        The latest estimated end time of the orders in the chain.

      • adjustDelays

        public void adjustDelays(int phaseDuration)
        Adjust the delays of orders in the chain of workstations.
        Parameters:
        phaseDuration - The actual duration of the phase.

      • getPhaseDuration

        public int getPhaseDuration(int workstationNumber)
        Returns the phase duration of the order in the workstation specified by the workstationNumber.
        Parameters:
        workstationNumber - The workstation whose order has to be checked.
        Returns:
        0 if workstationNumber is smaller than 0 or greater than the amount of workstations. 0 if there is no order present in the specified workstation. The phase duration of the order in the specified workstation otherwise.

      • getLastOrder

        public Order getLastOrder()
        Returns the order in the last workstation, if all tasks on the order are completed, so that it can be given to the statistics.
        Returns:
        The order in the last workstation.

      • allIdle

        public boolean allIdle()
        Checks if all workstations in the chain are idle.
        Returns:
        True if all workstations in the chain are idle. False otherwise.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Checks if this object is the same as a given object.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - The object against which we want to check equality.
        Returns:
        True if this object is the same as a given object False if the given object is null or the classes aren't the same or some fields do not have the same values.
